page.title: 13THE ROYAL ALBERT BRIDGE
page.content: {THE ROYAL ALBERT}TRAIN BRIDGE ACROSS THE{TAMAR}WAS DESIGNED BY THE FAMOUS ENGINEER ISAMBARD KINGDOM{BRUNEL}AND COST Â£230,000 TO BUILD. WORK STARTED IN ABOUT 1855 AND IT WAS OPENED BY {PRINCE ALBERT}ON 2ND MAY 1859 WHEN THE LARGEST CROWD EVER SEEN IN SALTASH WATCHED THE OPENING CEREMONY. THE FIRST TRAIN CROSSED THE BRIDGE ON 12TH APRIL 1859. IT IS 690M LONG WITH ITS GREATEST SPAN BEING 140M. THE BRIDGE RUNS 46M ABOVE HIGH WATER LEVEL. IT WAS WORLD FAMOUS BECAUSE IT WAS THE LONGEST SUSPENSION BRIDGE EVER BUILT AT THAT TIME. IN MEMORY OF BRUNEL THE PEOPLE OF SALTASH ERECTED A BUST OVERLOOKING THE BRIDGE WHICH WAS HIS LAST MASTERPIECE.
